level.text: Within ten (10) days of publication in the D.C. Register, any registered qualified elector who objects to the proposed formulations may request a hearing before the Board, pursuant to chapter 4 of this title, to raise any objections and/or correct any alleged inaccuracies or indicators of prejudice for or against the proposed Charter amendment(s).
If no hearing is requested, the proposed formulations, as published by the Board in the D.C. Register, shall be considered to be accepted at the expiration of the ten (10) day review period.

level.heading: SOURCE
level.text: Final Rulemaking published at 40 D.C. Reg. 7083, 7086 (October 8, 1993); as amended by Notice of Emergency and Proposed Rulemaking published at 59 DCR 627 (January 27, 2012)[EXPIRED]; as amended by Notice of Final Rulemaking published at 59 DCR 4780, 4783 (May 11, 2012).

level.heading: HISTORICAL NOTE
level.text: Prior to October 8, 1993, the Board of Elections and Ethics published Final Rulemaking notice published at 35 D.C. Reg. 5454, 5460 (July 15, 1988).
